intro: Lasiandra lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lasiandra lanceolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soil with partial to full shade.
